page.title: 15Colwall Probus Club
page.content: { Colwall Probus Club}was formed in December 1983 under the guidance of its founder chairman, Mr Geoffrey Frost, who had previously been a member of a similar club in Yorkshire. At inception there were sixteen founder members and by 1985 the number had grown to thirty-seven. Probus is derived from 'PROfessional' and 'BUSiness' and the club is open to men who have retired. It provides a meeting point for the members who appreciate and value additional opportunities for fellowship; the opportunity of listening to talks and taking part in discussions on current topics. Although there are many such clubs nationally each one is independent, there being no national organisation. The Colwall club meets twice monthly in the Colwall Park Hotel.
